edu.ucla.sspace.text

Interface CorpusReader<D extends Document>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BloglinesCorpusReader, BloglinesCorpusReader, ChildesCorpusReader, ChildesCorpusReader, DirectoryCorpusReader, PukWacCorpusReader, PukWacDependencyCorpusReader, SemEvalCorpusReader, SemEvalLexSubReader, SenseEvalDependencyCorpusReader, SenseEvalDependencyCorpusReader, TemporalBloglinesCorpusReader, TemporalBloglinesCorpusReader, TemporalUsenetCorpusReader, TemporalUsenetCorpusReader, UsenetCorpusReader, UsenetCorpusReader

    public interface CorpusReader<D extends Document>
    A basic interface for setting up a CorpusReader, which reads un cleaned text from corpus files and transforms them into an appropriately cleaned Document instance.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterator<D> read(File file)
      Returns a Iterator that traverses the documents containted in the given file.
      Iterator<D> read(Reader baseReader)
      Retrusn a Iterator that traverses the documents contained in baseReader.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        Iterator<D> read(File file)
        Returns a Iterator that traverses the documents containted in the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - A text file holding documents in a format that is readable by a particular CorpusReader. This text file may have it's own unique text structure or an xml format. Each CorpusReader should specify the expected text format.

      • read

        Iterator<D> read(Reader baseReader)
        Retrusn a Iterator that traverses the documents contained in baseReader.
        Parameters:
        baseReader - A Reader that will extract text from a data source, such as a URL, a File, a data stream, or any other source accesible via the Reader interface. Each CorpusReader should specify the expected text format, be it an XML schema or some other unique format.
